From: "Robinson, Brian" <brobinson@...>

I don't waste my time writing tests for modifiers on any class.  Rather, I
would test the methods that perform operations on the data that has been set
on the bean.  If those tests pass, then obviously the modifiers work
properly.

-Brian


-----Original Message-----
From: selena su [mailto:selena.su@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 21, 2001 11:54 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Choosing A Right Class.


Hi There:
     I believe that, not all the classes we would like to write a test
case or else we will have many test cases. Is there any concept choosing
the correct class to write test cases ?

thanks,
